item.title: Dan add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Dan add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "My fault, my failure, is not in the passions I have, but in my lack of control of them." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Dan add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "What is that feeling when you're driving away from people and they recede on the plain till you see their specks dispersing? - it's the too-huge world vaulting us, and it's good-bye. But we lean forward to the next crazy venture beneath the skies." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Dan add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "A pain stabbed my heart, as it did every time I saw a girl I loved who was going the opposite direction in this too-big world." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Dan add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Houses are full of things that gather dust" -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Dan add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "My witness is the empty sky." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Dan add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "I woke up as the sun was reddening; and that was the one distinct time in my life, the strangest moment of all, when I didn't know who I was - I was far away from home, haunted and tired with travel, in a cheap hotel room I'd never seen, hearing the hiss of steam outside, and the creak of the old wood of the hotel, and footsteps upstairs, and all the sad sounds, and I looked at the cracked high ceiling and really didn't know who I was for about fifteen strange seconds. I wasn't scared; I was just somebody else, some stranger, and my whole life was a haunted life, the life of a ghost." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Dan add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Life must be rich and full of loving--it's no good otherwise, no good at all, for anyone." -- Jack Kerouac
